It is native to New Zealand and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are an important food source for native birds. Coprosma acutifolia is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. It is also valued for its role in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
